New Records: Tobias Myers threw 9 scoreless innings against the Mets, with only 3 hits allowed and 10 strikeouts.
Key Match Events: Pete Alonso's 3-run homer led the Mets to a comeback win over the Brewers in NL wild-card Game 3.
Jake Bauers led off the 7th inning with a pinch-hit home run off Mets reliever José Buttó.
Sal Frelick followed up with a home run of his own on the next pitch to give Milwaukee a 2–0 lead.
Starling Marte brought home Jesse Winker with a double to add another run, giving the Mets a 4–2 lead.
David Peterson closed out the victory for the Mets, getting Brice Turang to ground into a game-ending double play.
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets' bats were quiet until they surged to life in the ninth inning.
The Mets' manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mets advance to the NL division series to face the Philadelphia Phillies.
The Mets' lineup had nothing for the Brewers' bullpen, either, with three Milwaukee relievers allowing no runs and no hits over the next three innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Empire State Building was lit up in blue and orange to celebrate the Mets' playoff series win.
The game was a thrilling comeback win for the Mets.
The Mets went 6–7 against the Phillies during the regular season.
Others: The game was played on October 4, 2024, at American Family Field in Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
